docs.lead_paragraph: P. J. Brown spoke at a children's basketball camp last summer at the University of New Orleans, going on about what it means to be a good sport. He was pulling it off until he was interrupted by a 10-year-old boy. ''Sportsmanship?'' he said. ''What kind of sportsmanship was that in the playoffs?''

headline.main: Turning a Thug's Image on Its Head

docs.abstract: Miami Heat basketball player P J Brown discusses his 'bad boy' image as he prepares for playoff series against New York Knickerbockers; photo (M)
docs.snippet: P. J. Brown spoke at a children's basketball camp last summer at the University of New Orleans, going on about what it means to be a good sport. He was pulling it off until he was interrupted by a 10-year-old boy.    ''Sportsmanship?'' he said....

docs.lead_paragraph: Fighting back tears, Amy S. Grossberg pleaded guilty to manslaughter today in the death of her newborn son in late 1996, sparing herself a murder trial and possible life sentence. Her plea ended a criminal case that attracted broad interest after Delaware authorities said that the baby was ruthlessly discarded in a motel trash bin and that they would seek the death penalty against her and her former boyfriend, Brian C. Peterson.

headline.main: Teen-Ager Pleads Guilty in Death Of Her Newborn, as Boyfriend Did

docs.abstract: Amy S Grossberg pleads guilty to manslaughter in death of her newborn son in late 1996, sparing herself murder trial and possible life sentence; her plea ends criminal case that attracted broad interest after Delaware authorities said that baby was ruthlessly discarded in motel trash bin and that they would seek death penalty against her and her former boyfriend, Brian C Peterson; plea bargain reflects retreat by her defense team and Delaware Attorney General's office; single manslaughter count is identical to one to which Peterson pleaded guilty and leaves two 19-year-olds facing maximum of 10 years in prison; photo (M)
